title: Germany's Merkel calls for peaceful resolution in Hong Kong
text:
"I pointed out that these rights and freedoms must of course be guaranteed," German Chancellor Angela Merkel told a news conference after meeting Chinese Premier Li Keqiang.

Merkel was on a two-day trip to China to push Beijing to open up its markets and embrace fairer competition.

In the same news conference, China's Li said the Chinese government unswervingly safeguards 'one country, two systems' and 'Hong Kong people govern Hong Kong people'".

Hong Kong is bracing for more demonstrations this weekend, with protesters threatening to disrupt transport links to the airport, after embattled leader Carrie Lam's withdrawal of a controversial extradition bill failed to appease some activists.
description:
"I pointed out that these rights and freedoms must of course be guaranteed," German Chancellor Angela Merkel told a news conference after meeting Chinese Premier Li Keqiang. 
              Merkel was on a two-day trip to China to push Beijing to open up its markets and embrace fairer competition. 
              In the same news conference, China's Li said the Chinese government unswervingly safeguards 'one country, two systems' and 'Hong Kong people govern Hong Kong people'". 
              Hong Kong is bracing for more demonstrations this weekend, with protesters threatening to disrupt transport links to the airport, after embattled leader Carrie Lam's withdrawal of a controversial extradition bill failed to appease some activists.
